meanings.definition: A white or colorless mineral consisting of barium sulfate.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found a chunk of barytas during the excavation.
meanings.sent2: Artists use barytas to create bright white paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook barytas for snow and tried to bury it.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as pure and bright as barytas under the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The barytas sparkled like tiny diamonds in the rock.

meanings.definition: A white pigment made from barytas.
meanings.sent1: The painter mixed barytas with other colors to create a unique shade.
meanings.sent2: The art store ran out of barytas, so she had to use a different pigment.
meanings.sent3: The barytas powder poofed into the air like a cloud of magic dust.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was as white as freshly fallen barytas on a winter morning.
meanings.sent5: The barytas pigment gave the painting a luminous quality.
